com.salesforce.androidsdk.accounts

Class UserAccountManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.androidsdk.accounts.UserAccountManager

  • public class UserAccountManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class acts as a manager that provides methods to access user accounts that are currently logged in, and can be used to add new user accounts.
    Author:
    bhariharan

    • Field Detail

      • USER_SWITCH_INTENT_ACTION

        public static final java.lang.String USER_SWITCH_INTENT_ACTION
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_USER_SWITCH_TYPE

        public static final java.lang.String EXTRA_USER_SWITCH_TYPE
        Represents how the current user has been switched to, as found in an intent sent to a BroadcastReceiver filtering USER_SWITCH_INTENT_ACTION. User switching including logging in, logging out and switching between authenticated users. For backwards compatibility, the case where the last user has logged out is not included, as this currently does not send a broadcast.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_SWITCH_TYPE_DEFAULT

        public static final int USER_SWITCH_TYPE_DEFAULT
        A switch has occurred between two authenticated users.

        Use this constant with EXTRA_USER_SWITCH_TYPE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_SWITCH_TYPE_FIRST_LOGIN

        public static final int USER_SWITCH_TYPE_FIRST_LOGIN
        The first user has logged in and is being switched to. There were no users authenticated before this switch.

        Use this constant with EXTRA_USER_SWITCH_TYPE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_SWITCH_TYPE_LOGIN

        public static final int USER_SWITCH_TYPE_LOGIN
        An additional user has logged in and is being switched to. There was at least one user authenticated before this switch.

        Use this constant with EXTRA_USER_SWITCH_TYPE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • USER_SWITCH_TYPE_LOGOUT

        public static final int USER_SWITCH_TYPE_LOGOUT
        A user has a logged out and another authenticated user is being switched to.

        Use this constant with EXTRA_USER_SWITCH_TYPE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getCachedCurrentUser

        public UserAccount getCachedCurrentUser()
        Returns a cached value of the current user. NB: The oauth tokens might be outdated Should be used by methods that only care about the current user's identity (org id, user id etc) Is faster than getCurrentUser()
        Returns:
        Current user that's logged in (with potentially outdated oauth tokens)

        Parameters:

        True - if it exists, False - otherwise.

      • switchToUser

        public void switchToUser(UserAccount user)
        Switches to the specified user account. If the specified user account is invalid/doesn't exist, this method kicks off the login flow for a new user. When the user account switch is complete, it is imperative for the app to update its cached references to RestClient, to avoid holding on to a RestClient from the previous user.
        Parameters:
        user - User account to switch to.

      • switchToUser

        public void switchToUser(UserAccount user,
                         int userSwitchType,
                         Bundle extras)
        Switches to the specified user account.
        Parameters:
        user - the user account to switch to
        userSwitchType - a USER_SWITCH_TYPE constant
        extras - a optional Bundle of extras to pass additional information during user switch
        See Also:
        switchToUser(UserAccount)

      • switchToNewUser

        public void switchToNewUser()
        Kicks off the login flow to switch to a new user. Once the login flow is complete, the context will automatically become the new user's context and a call to peekRestClient() or getRestClient() in ClientManager will return a RestClient instance for the new user.

      • signoutUser

        public void signoutUser(UserAccount userAccount,
                        Activity frontActivity)
        Logs the specified user out. If the user specified is not the current user, push notification un-registration will not take place.
        Parameters:
        userAccount - User account.
        frontActivity - Front activity.

      • signoutUser

        public void signoutUser(UserAccount userAccount,
                        Activity frontActivity,
                        boolean showLoginPage)
        Logs the specified user out. If the user specified is not the current user, push notification un-registration will not take place.
        Parameters:
        userAccount - User account.
        frontActivity - Front activity.
        showLoginPage - True - if the login page should be shown, False - otherwise.

      • signoutUser

                        Activity frontActivity,
                        boolean showLoginPage,
                        OAuth2.LogoutReason reason)
        Logs the specified user out. If the user specified is not the current user, push notification un-registration will not take place.
        Parameters:
        userAccount - User account.
        frontActivity - Front activity.
        showLoginPage - True - if the login page should be shown, False - otherwise.
        reason - The reason for the logout.

      • refreshToken

        public void refreshToken(UserAccount userAccount)
        Attempts to refresh the access token for this user by making an API call to the "/token" endpoint. If the call succeeds, the new token is persisted. If the call fails and the refresh token is no longer valid, the user is logged out. This should NOT be called from the main thread because it makes a network request.
        Parameters:
        userAccount - User account whose token should be refreshed. Use 'null' for current user.
